p: A water-soluble polysaccharide (ORWP) from Hymenopellis radicata also inhibited the growth mould P. digitatum by disrupting the hyphal membrane, leading to leakage of intracellular materials, and impaired cellular metabolism [ 116]. There are other promising compounds identified with antimicrobial activities which do not belong to the group of strobilurins. One is scalusamide A, an antifungal agent and its derivatives (B,C) isolated from Xerula sp. BCC56836 [ 113].
